metadata.name: Python Inline Command Execution
metadata.comment: Detects execution of python using the "-c" flag. This is could be used as a way to launch a reverse shell or execute live python code.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('python.exe') AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('python.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('python3.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('python2.exe'))) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -c')) AND NOT (startswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('c:\\program files\\python')) AND endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\python.exe')) AND contains(lower(process.parent_process.cmd_line), lower('-e -s -m ensurepip -u --default-pip')) OR endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\appdata\\local\\programs\\microsoft vs code\\code.exe'))))

output.summary: Detects execution of python using the "-c" flag. This is could be used as a way to launch a reverse shell or execute live python code.

metadata.objective: False positive: Python libraries that use a flag starting with "-c". Filter according to your environment References: https://docs.python.org/3/using/cmdline.html#cmdoption-c, https://www.revshells.com/, https://pentestmonkey.net/cheat-sheet/shells/reverse-shell-cheat-sheet
